sect1.title: Class Logger
sect1.para: The Logger class handles all of the displaying of log text to the console gui in the correct tabs. The class works on a level based system, in which only the levels which meet or exceed the minimum log level are output to the gui console.

sect2.title: CRITICAL
sect2.para: The highest level of logging so far.

sect2.title: DEBUG
sect2.para: This is the default level used for any log call that doesn't have an explicit log level defined

sect2.title: INFO
sect2.para: This is a level above the debug level

sect2.title: getLogLevel()getLogLevelMethodsgetLogLevel
sect2.para: Get the lowest level of log content to be output to the gui console.

sect2.title: log(Object)logMethodslog
sect2.para: Send a message to the GUI console with the given message at the Logger.DEBUG log level.

sect2.title: log(Object, int)logMethodslog
sect2.para: Send a message to the GUI console with the given message at the desired log level.

sect2.title: setLogLevel(int)setLogLevelMethodssetLogLevel
sect2.para: Sets the minimum log level to display in the console

sect1.title: Class SmartSocketServer
sect1.para: This class is basically a class that is launched if someone were to launch SmartSocket.jar by itself, instead of using it in their library path. It will basically have some information on how the class is meant to be used, with some useful tutorial-like information.

sect2.title: open()openMethodsopen
sect2.para: This method is called directly after the GUI is launched when launched as a standalone jar. Here, we'll simply display some information on how SmartSocket is supposed to be used.

sect1.title: Class AbstractClient
sect1.para: Later on, when UDPClients become available, this class will have more effect. Right now, this class is pretty much used as a base class for a few calls. Pretty much disregard this skeleton class for now.

sect2.title: Synopsis
sect2.para: Direct known subclasses: net.­smartsocket.­clients.­TCPClientnet.­smartsocket.­clients.­UDPClient

sect2.title: getUniqueId()getUniqueIdMethodsgetUniqueId
sect2.para: Some sort of unique identifier to assign this client.

sect2.title: setUniqueId(Object)setUniqueIdMethodssetUniqueId
sect2.para: Some sort of unique identifier to assign this client.

sect1.title: Class TCPClient
sect1.para: The TCPClient class controls the dedicated thread, and input/output for the TCP client. This class does not need to be instantiated by any end users; it's created automatically when the client is accepted by the server socket.

sect2.title: getClients()getClientsMethodsgetClients
sect2.para: A list of all TCPClient objects that are running across all extensions

sect2.title: getInboundBytes()getInboundBytesMethodsgetInboundBytes
sect2.para: The number of inbound bytes that have been received since the last wipe on the StatisticsTracker poll.

sect2.title: getOutboundBytes()getOutboundBytesMethodsgetOutboundBytes
sect2.para: The number of outbound bytes that have been received since the last wipe on the StatisticsTracker poll.

sect2.title: send(ClientCall)sendMethodssend
sect2.para: The ClientCall message to send to this client

sect2.title: setInboundBytes(long)setInboundBytesMethodssetInboundBytes
sect2.para: The number of inbound bytes that have been received since the last wipe on the StatisticsTracker poll.

sect2.title: setOutboundBytes(long)setOutboundBytesMethodssetOutboundBytes
sect2.para: The number of outbound bytes that have been received since the last wipe on the StatisticsTracker poll.

sect1.title: Class UDPClient
sect1.para: This class will end up mirroring TCPClient in many ways. Implementation for his class will come soon. Sooner if there is more interest in implementing it from fellow 'forkers'.

sect1.title: Class MultiExtensionExample
sect1.para: A simple class that models how to instantiate a couple test TCPExtension based extensions. You can make a class like this if you are planning on having several extensions running on your server. You can pretty much run as many extensions as your server can handle.

sect1.title: Class TCPTest1
sect1.para: A very simple shell of a TCPExtension extension which includes all abstract methods and a simple onHelloWorld method.

sect2.title: onHelloWorld(TCPClient, JSONObject)onHelloWorldMethodsonHelloWorld
sect2.para: A simple method that can be called by sending a JSON string that looks like ["onHelloWorld",{"test","some test data"}]

listitem.para: The JSONException is thrown by the JSON.org classes when things are amiss.

sect1.title: Class TCPTest2
sect1.para: A very simple shell of a TCPExtension extension which includes all abstract methods and a simple onHelloWorld method.

sect2.title: onHelloWorld(TCPClient, JSONObject)onHelloWorldMethodsonHelloWorld
sect2.para: A simple method that can be called by sending a JSON string that looks like ["onHelloWorld",{"test","some test data"}]

listitem.para: The JSONException is thrown by the JSON.org classes when things are amiss.

sect1.title: Class AbstractExtension
sect1.para: This abstract extension is just a skeleton class that holds the runnable and thread lines that allow TCP and later UDP extensions to be runnable. Disregard this class for the time being, it's only used in a few calls in some of the code.

sect2.title: Synopsis
sect2.para: Direct known subclasses: net.­smartsocket.­extensions.­TCPExtensionnet.­smartsocket.­extensions.­UDPExtension

sect1.title: Class TCPExtension
sect1.para: The TCPExtension class is an abstract class that provides the shell around which all extensions using the TCP protocol will use. This class handles setting up the actual server, creating the initial console gui, extension tabs on the gui, as well as accepting connections and creating separate thread for each client (TCPClient).

sect2.title: Synopsis
sect2.para: Direct known subclasses: net.­smartsocket.­examples.­TCPTest1net.­smartsocket.­examples.­TCPTest2

sect2.title: addClient(TCPClient)addClientMethodsaddClient
sect2.para: Add a TCPClient to the allClients deque from this extension instance.

sect2.title: broadcastMessage(ClientCall)broadcastMessageMethodsbroadcastMessage
sect2.para: Broadcast a message to all connected TCP clients

sect2.title: broadcastMessageLocal(ClientCall)broadcastMessageLocalMethodsbroadcastMessageLocal
sect2.para: Broadcast a message to all connected clients on this local TCPExtension instance

sect2.title: getClients()getClientsMethodsgetClients
sect2.para: This deque contains all of the clients that are currently connected to this TCPExtension instance.

sect2.title: getExtension()getExtensionMethodsgetExtension
sect2.para: The class of the extension object

sect2.title: getExtensionInstance()getExtensionInstanceMethodsgetExtensionInstance
sect2.para: The instance object of the extension class.

sect2.title: getExtensionName()getExtensionNameMethodsgetExtensionName
sect2.para: The string name of the extension class.

sect2.title: getNewlineCharacter()getNewlineCharacterMethodsgetNewlineCharacter
sect2.para: This is the newline character that is sent at the end of each send to the client. It can be changed on an extension-level basis. It's necessary to have this functionality because different client languages (c/++, Java, ActionScript, etc.) will have different line ending characters that are used for socket connection read/write.
Default is set to \r\n

sect2.title: getPort()getPortMethodsgetPort
sect2.para: The port number that this extension is running on

sect2.title: getSocket()getSocketMethodsgetSocket
sect2.para: The server's socket object

sect2.title: getThread()getThreadMethodsgetThread
sect2.para: The current thread id that this extension instance is running on

sect2.title: isRunning()isRunningMethodsisRunning
sect2.para: Determines if the server is running or not. When set to false, this server will cease to accept incoming connections.

sect2.title: onConnect(TCPClient)onConnectMethodsonConnect
sect2.para: This method will be called on the extension when a user joins the server.

sect2.title: onDisconnect(TCPClient)onDisconnectMethodsonDisconnect
sect2.para: This method will be called on the extension when a user leaves the server.

sect2.title: onExtensionReady()onExtensionReadyMethodsonExtensionReady
sect2.para: This method will be called on the extension the server is ready for business.

sect2.title: removeClient(TCPClient)removeClientMethodsremoveClient
sect2.para: Remove a TCPClient from the allClients deque from this extension instance.

sect2.title: setNewlineCharacter(String)setNewlineCharacterMethodssetNewlineCharacter
sect2.para: This is the newline character that is sent at the end of each send to the client. It can be changed on an extension-level basis. It's necessary to have this functionality because different client languages (c/++, Java, ActionScript, etc.) will have different line ending characters that are used for socket connection read/write.
Default is set to \r\n

sect2.title: setRunning(boolean)setRunningMethodssetRunning
sect2.para: Determines if the server is running or not. When set to false, this server will cease to accept incoming connections.

sect1.title: Class UDPExtension
sect1.para: This class will end up mirroring TCPExtension in many ways. Implementation for his class will come soon. Sooner if there is more interest in implementing it from fellow 'forkers'.

sect1.title: Class ConsoleForm
sect1.para: The ConsoleForm class is the hub of all gui activity.

sect2.title: ConsoleForm()ConsoleFormMethodsConsoleForm
sect2.para: Creates new form ConsoleForm

sect2.title: start(AbstractExtension)startMethodsstart
sect2.para: This method is called when TCP, or UDP extension is initialized. If there are multiple extensions that will be ran, only the first extension to load will effect this console form. The addition of the tabs for each extension is done through the actual TCPExtension and UDPExtension classes.

sect1.title: Class ExtensionConsole
sect1.para: This class controls adding the tab interface and dedicated console for each extension. Modification of this class should be done for customization of the display of the extension's tabbed controller.

sect2.title: ExtensionConsole(String)ExtensionConsoleMethodsExtensionConsole
sect2.para: The constructor of the component to be displayed in the tabbed pane

entry.para: Currently unused, but may be in the future.

sect1.title: Class StatisticsTracker
sect1.para: Statistics tracker is a class that controls displaying how many clients are connected, etc., in the bottom of the GUI

sect2.title: start()startMethodsstart
sect2.para: Start the timer which controls displaying memory, uptime, upstream, and downstream

sect2.title: updateClientsConnectedLabel()updateClientsConnectedLabelMethodsupdateClientsConnectedLabel
sect2.para: This is called when a user connects or disconnects from the server, showing the correct number in the GUI

sect2.title: updateDownstreamLabel()updateDownstreamLabelMethodsupdateDownstreamLabel
sect2.para: Display the server's current downstream

sect2.title: updateMemoryUsageLabel()updateMemoryUsageLabelMethodsupdateMemoryUsageLabel
sect2.para: Display roughly the server's current memory usage.

sect2.title: updateUpstreamLabel()updateUpstreamLabelMethodsupdateUpstreamLabel
sect2.para: Display the server's current upstream

sect2.title: updateUptimeLabel()updateUptimeLabelMethodsupdateUptimeLabel
sect2.para: Show the uptime of the server in the GUI

sect1.title: Class ClientCall
sect1.para: The ClientCall class is a simple way to construct a JSON formatted message to send to a client.

sect2.title: ClientCall(String)ClientCallMethodsClientCall
sect2.para: Instantiate a new ClientCall object for calling a method on a client.

entry.para: The String name of the method to be called on the client.

sect2.title: put(String, Object)putMethodsput
sect2.para: Create or modify a property on the client call.

entry.para: The key name of the property

sect1.title: Class CDL
sect1.para: This provides static methods to convert comma delimited text into a JSONArray, and to covert a JSONArray into comma delimited text. Comma delimited text is a very popular format for data interchange. It is understood by most database, spreadsheet, and organizer programs.

Each row of text represents a row in a table or a data record. Each row ends with a NEWLINE character. Each row contains one or more values. Values are separated by commas. A value can contain any character except for comma, unless is is wrapped in single quotes or double quotes.
The first row usually contains the names of the columns.
A comma delimited list can be converted into a JSONArray of JSONObjects. The names for the elements in the JSONObjects can be taken from the names in the first row.

sect2.title: rowToJSONArray(JSONTokener)rowToJSONArrayMethodsrowToJSONArray
sect2.para: Produce a JSONArray of strings from a row of comma delimited values.

entry.para: A JSONTokener of the source text.

listitem.para: The JSONException is thrown by the JSON.org classes when things are amiss.

sect2.title: rowToJSONObject(JSONArray, JSONTokener)rowToJSONObjectMethodsrowToJSONObject
sect2.para: Produce a JSONObject from a row of comma delimited text, using a parallel JSONArray of strings to provides the names of the elements.

entry.para: A JSONArray of names. This is commonly obtained from the first row of a comma delimited text file using the rowToJSONArray method.
A JSONTokener of the source text.
A JSONObject combining the names and values.

listitem.para: The JSONException is thrown by the JSON.org classes when things are amiss.

sect2.title: rowToString(JSONArray)rowToStringMethodsrowToString
sect2.para: Produce a comma delimited text row from a JSONArray. Values containing the comma character will be quoted. Troublesome characters may be removed.

sect2.title: toJSONArray(JSONArray, JSONTokener)toJSONArrayMethodstoJSONArray
sect2.para: Produce a JSONArray of JSONObjects from a comma delimited text string using a supplied JSONArray as the source of element names.

entry.para: A JSONTokener of the source text.

listitem.para: The JSONException is thrown by the JSON.org classes when things are amiss.

sect2.title: toJSONArray(JSONArray, String)toJSONArrayMethodstoJSONArray
sect2.para: Produce a JSONArray of JSONObjects from a comma delimited text string using a supplied JSONArray as the source of element names.

listitem.para: The JSONException is thrown by the JSON.org classes when things are amiss.

sect2.title: toJSONArray(JSONTokener)toJSONArrayMethodstoJSONArray
sect2.para: Produce a JSONArray of JSONObjects from a comma delimited text string, using the first row as a source of names.

entry.para: The JSONTokener containing the comma delimited text.

listitem.para: The JSONException is thrown by the JSON.org classes when things are amiss.

sect2.title: toJSONArray(String)toJSONArrayMethodstoJSONArray
sect2.para: Produce a JSONArray of JSONObjects from a comma delimited text string, using the first row as a source of names.

listitem.para: The JSONException is thrown by the JSON.org classes when things are amiss.

sect2.title: toString(JSONArray)toStringMethodstoString
sect2.para: Produce a comma delimited text from a JSONArray of JSONObjects. The first row will be a list of names obtained by inspecting the first JSONObject.

listitem.para: The JSONException is thrown by the JSON.org classes when things are amiss.

sect2.title: toString(JSONArray, JSONArray)toStringMethodstoString
sect2.para: Produce a comma delimited text from a JSONArray of JSONObjects using a provided list of names. The list of names is not included in the output.

listitem.para: The JSONException is thrown by the JSON.org classes when things are amiss.

sect1.title: Class Cookie
sect1.para: Convert a web browser cookie specification to a JSONObject and back. JSON and Cookies are both notations for name/value pairs.

sect2.title: escape(String)escapeMethodsescape
sect2.para: Produce a copy of a string in which the characters '+', '%', '=', ';' and control characters are replaced with "%hh". This is a gentle form of URL encoding, attempting to cause as little distortion to the string as possible. The characters '=' and ';' are meta characters in cookies. By convention, they are escaped using the URL-encoding. This is only a convention, not a standard. Often, cookies are expected to have encoded values. We encode '=' and ';' because we must. We encode '%' and '+' because they are meta characters in URL encoding.

sect2.title: toJSONObject(String)toJSONObjectMethodstoJSONObject
sect2.para: Convert a cookie specification string into a JSONObject. The string will contain a name value pair separated by '='. The name and the value will be unescaped, possibly converting '+' and '%' sequences. The cookie properties may follow, separated by ';', also represented as name=value (except the secure property, which does not have a value). The name will be stored under the key "name", and the value will be stored under the key "value". This method does not do checking or validation of the parameters. It only converts the cookie string into a JSONObject.

entry.para: A JSONObject containing "name", "value", and possibly other members.

listitem.para: The JSONException is thrown by the JSON.org classes when things are amiss.

sect2.title: toString(JSONObject)toStringMethodstoString
sect2.para: Convert a JSONObject into a cookie specification string. The JSONObject must contain "name" and "value" members. If the JSONObject contains "expires", "domain", "path", or "secure" members, they will be appended to the cookie specification string. All other members are ignored.

listitem.para: The JSONException is thrown by the JSON.org classes when things are amiss.

sect2.title: unescape(String)unescapeMethodsunescape
sect2.para: Convert %hh sequences to single characters, and convert plus to space.

entry.para: A string that may contain + (plus) and %hh sequences.

sect1.title: Class CookieList
sect1.para: Convert a web browser cookie list string to a JSONObject and back.

sect2.title: toJSONObject(String)toJSONObjectMethodstoJSONObject
sect2.para: Convert a cookie list into a JSONObject. A cookie list is a sequence of name/value pairs. The names are separated from the values by '='. The pairs are separated by ';'. The names and the values will be unescaped, possibly converting '+' and '%' sequences. To add a cookie to a cooklist, cookielistJSONObject.put(cookieJSONObject.getString("name"), cookieJSONObject.getString("value"));

listitem.para: The JSONException is thrown by the JSON.org classes when things are amiss.

sect2.title: toString(JSONObject)toStringMethodstoString
sect2.para: Convert a JSONObject into a cookie list. A cookie list is a sequence of name/value pairs. The names are separated from the values by '='. The pairs are separated by ';'. The characters '%', '+', '=', and ';' in the names and values are replaced by "%hh".

listitem.para: The JSONException is thrown by the JSON.org classes when things are amiss.

sect1.title: Class HTTP
sect1.para: Convert an HTTP header to a JSONObject and back.

sect2.title: CRLF
sect2.para: Carriage return/line feed.

sect2.title: toJSONObject(String)toJSONObjectMethodstoJSONObject
sect2.para: Convert an HTTP header string into a JSONObject. It can be a request header or a response header. A request header will contain

A response header will contain { "HTTP-Version": "HTTP/1.1" (for example), "Status-Code": "200" (for example), "Reason-Phrase": "OK" (for example) } In addition, the other parameters in the header will be captured, using the HTTP field names as JSON names, so that Date: Sun, 26 May 2002 18:06:04 GMT Cookie: Q=q2=PPEAsg--; B=677gi6ouf29bn&b=2&f=s Cache-Control: no-cache become {... Date: "Sun, 26 May 2002 18:06:04 GMT", Cookie: "Q=q2=PPEAsg--; B=677gi6ouf29bn&b=2&f=s", "Cache-Control": "no-cache", ...} It does no further checking or conversion. It does not parse dates. It does not do '%' transforms on URLs.

entry.para: A JSONObject containing the elements and attributes of the XML string.

listitem.para: The JSONException is thrown by the JSON.org classes when things are amiss.

sect2.title: toString(JSONObject)toStringMethodstoString
sect2.para: Convert a JSONObject into an HTTP header. A request header must contain

listitem.para: if the object does not contain enough information.

sect1.title: Class HTTPTokener
sect1.para: The HTTPTokener extends the JSONTokener to provide additional methods for the parsing of HTTP headers.

sect2.title: HTTPTokener(String)HTTPTokenerMethodsHTTPTokener

sect2.title: nextToken()nextTokenMethodsnextToken
sect2.para: Get the next token or string. This is used in parsing HTTP headers.

listitem.para: The JSONException is thrown by the JSON.org classes when things are amiss.

sect1.title: Class JSONArray
sect1.para: A JSONArray is an ordered sequence of values. Its external text form is a string wrapped in square brackets with commas separating the values. The internal form is an object having get and opt methods for accessing the values by index, and put methods for adding or replacing values. The values can be any of these types: Boolean, JSONArray, JSONObject, Number, String, or the JSONObject.NULL object.
The constructor can convert a JSON text into a Java object. The toString method converts to JSON text.

A get method returns a value if one can be found, and throws an exception if one cannot be found. An opt method returns a default value instead of throwing an exception, and so is useful for obtaining optional values.
The generic get() and opt() methods return an object which you can cast or query for type. There are also typed get and opt methods that do type checking and type coercion for you.
The texts produced by the toString methods strictly conform to JSON syntax rules. The constructors are more forgiving in the texts they will accept:

listitem.para: An extra , (comma) may appear just before the closing bracket.
The null value will be inserted when there is , (comma) elision.
Strings may be quoted with

sect2.para: Direct known subclasses: net.­smartsocket.­protocols.­json.­ClientCall

listitem.para: If the key is not found or if the value cannot be converted to a number.

entry.para: The index must be between 0 and length() - 1.

entry.para: The index must be between 0 and length() - 1.

sect2.para: Get the string associated with an index.

sect2.title: isNull(int)isNullMethodsisNull
sect2.para: Determine if the value is null.

entry.para: The index must be between 0 and length() - 1.
true if the value at the index is null, or if there is no value.

sect2.title: join(String)joinMethodsjoin
sect2.para: Make a string from the contents of this JSONArray. The separator string is inserted between each element. Warning: This method assumes that the data structure is acyclical.

entry.para: A string that will be inserted between the elements.

listitem.para: If the array contains an invalid number.

sect2.title: length()lengthMethodslength
sect2.para: Get the number of elements in the JSONArray, included nulls.

sect2.title: opt(int)optMethodsopt
sect2.para: Get the optional object value associated with an index.

entry.para: The index must be between 0 and length() - 1.
An object value, or null if there is no object at that index.

sect2.title: optBoolean(int)optBooleanMethodsoptBoolean
sect2.para: Get the optional boolean value associated with an index. It returns false if there is no value at that index, or if the value is not Boolean.TRUE or the String "true".

entry.para: The index must be between 0 and length() - 1.

sect2.title: optBoolean(int, boolean)optBooleanMethodsoptBoolean
sect2.para: Get the optional boolean value associated with an index. It returns the defaultValue if there is no value at that index or if it is not a Boolean or the String "true" or "false" (case insensitive).

entry.para: The index must be between 0 and length() - 1.

sect2.title: optDouble(int)optDoubleMethodsoptDouble
sect2.para: Get the optional double value associated with an index. NaN is returned if there is no value for the index, or if the value is not a number and cannot be converted to a number.

entry.para: The index must be between 0 and length() - 1.

sect2.title: optDouble(int, double)optDoubleMethodsoptDouble
sect2.para: Get the optional double value associated with an index. The defaultValue is returned if there is no value for the index, or if the value is not a number and cannot be converted to a number.

sect2.title: optInt(int)optIntMethodsoptInt
sect2.para: Get the optional int value associated with an index. Zero is returned if there is no value for the index, or if the value is not a number and cannot be converted to a number.

entry.para: The index must be between 0 and length() - 1.

sect2.title: optInt(int, int)optIntMethodsoptInt
sect2.para: Get the optional int value associated with an index. The defaultValue is returned if there is no value for the index, or if the value is not a number and cannot be converted to a number.

entry.para: The index must be between 0 and length() - 1.

sect2.title: optJSONArray(int)optJSONArrayMethodsoptJSONArray
sect2.para: Get the optional JSONArray associated with an index.

entry.para: A JSONArray value, or null if the index has no value, or if the value is not a JSONArray.

sect2.title: optJSONObject(int)optJSONObjectMethodsoptJSONObject
sect2.para: Get the optional JSONObject associated with an index. Null is returned if the key is not found, or null if the index has no value, or if the value is not a JSONObject.

entry.para: The index must be between 0 and length() - 1.

sect2.title: optLong(int)optLongMethodsoptLong
sect2.para: Get the optional long value associated with an index. Zero is returned if there is no value for the index, or if the value is not a number and cannot be converted to a number.

entry.para: The index must be between 0 and length() - 1.

sect2.title: optLong(int, long)optLongMethodsoptLong
sect2.para: Get the optional long value associated with an index. The defaultValue is returned if there is no value for the index, or if the value is not a number and cannot be converted to a number.

entry.para: The index must be between 0 and length() - 1.

sect2.title: optString(int)optStringMethodsoptString
sect2.para: Get the optional string value associated with an index. It returns an empty string if there is no value at that index. If the value is not a string and is not null, then it is coverted to a string.

entry.para: The index must be between 0 and length() - 1.

sect2.title: optString(int, String)optStringMethodsoptString
sect2.para: Get the optional string associated with an index. The defaultValue is returned if the key is not found.

entry.para: The index must be between 0 and length() - 1.

sect2.title: put(boolean)putMethodsput
sect2.para: Append a boolean value. This increases the array's length by one.

sect2.title: put(Collection)putMethodsput
sect2.para: Put a value in the JSONArray, where the value will be a JSONArray which is produced from a Collection.

sect2.title: put(double)putMethodsput
sect2.para: Append a double value. This increases the array's length by one.

listitem.para: if the value is not finite.

sect2.title: put(int)putMethodsput
sect2.para: Append an int value. This increases the array's length by one.

sect2.title: put(int, boolean)putMethodsput
sect2.para: Put or replace a boolean value in the JSONArray. If the index is greater than the length of the JSONArray, then null elements will be added as necessary to pad it out.

listitem.para: If the index is negative.

sect2.title: put(int, Collection)putMethodsput
sect2.para: Put a value in the JSONArray, where the value will be a JSONArray which is produced from a Collection.

listitem.para: If the index is negative or if the value is not finite.

sect2.title: put(int, double)putMethodsput
sect2.para: Put or replace a double value. If the index is greater than the length of the JSONArray, then null elements will be added as necessary to pad it out.

listitem.para: If the index is negative or if the value is not finite.

sect2.title: put(int, int)putMethodsput
sect2.para: Put or replace an int value. If the index is greater than the length of the JSONArray, then null elements will be added as necessary to pad it out.

listitem.para: If the index is negative.

sect2.title: put(int, long)putMethodsput
sect2.para: Put or replace a long value. If the index is greater than the length of the JSONArray, then null elements will be added as necessary to pad it out.

listitem.para: If the index is negative.

sect2.title: put(int, Map)putMethodsput
sect2.para: Put a value in the JSONArray, where the value will be a JSONObject which is produced from a Map.

listitem.para: If the index is negative or if the the value is an invalid number.

sect2.title: put(int, Object)putMethodsput
sect2.para: Put or replace an object value in the JSONArray. If the index is greater than the length of the JSONArray, then null elements will be added as necessary to pad it out.

entry.para: The value to put into the array. The value should be a Boolean, Double, Integer, JSONArray, JSONObject, Long, or String, or the JSONObject.NULL object.

listitem.para: If the index is negative or if the the value is an invalid number.

sect2.title: put(long)putMethodsput
sect2.para: Append an long value. This increases the array's length by one.

sect2.title: put(Map)putMethodsput
sect2.para: Put a value in the JSONArray, where the value will be a JSONObject which is produced from a Map.

sect2.title: put(Object)putMethodsput
sect2.para: Append an object value. This increases the array's length by one.

entry.para: An object value. The value should be a Boolean, Double, Integer, JSONArray, JSONObject, Long, or String, or the JSONObject.NULL object.

sect2.title: remove(int)removeMethodsremove
sect2.para: Remove an index and close the hole.

entry.para: The index of the element to be removed.
The value that was associated with the index, or null if there was no value.

sect2.title: toJSONObject(JSONArray)toJSONObjectMethodstoJSONObject
sect2.para: Produce a JSONObject by combining a JSONArray of names with the values of this JSONArray.

entry.para: A JSONArray containing a list of key strings. These will be paired with the values.
A JSONObject, or null if there are no names or if this JSONArray has no values.

listitem.para: If any of the names are null.

sect2.title: toString()toStringMethodstoString
sect2.para: Make a JSON text of this JSONArray. For compactness, no unnecessary whitespace is added. If it is not possible to produce a syntactically correct JSON text then null will be returned instead. This could occur if the array contains an invalid number.
Warning: This method assumes that the data structure is acyclical.

entry.para: a printable, displayable, transmittable representation of the array.

sect2.title: toString(int)toStringMethodstoString
sect2.para: Make a prettyprinted JSON text of this JSONArray. Warning: This method assumes that the data structure is acyclical.

entry.para: The number of spaces to add to each level of indentation.
a printable, displayable, transmittable representation of the object, beginning with [ (left bracket) and ending with ] (right bracket).

listitem.para: The JSONException is thrown by the JSON.org classes when things are amiss.

sect2.title: write(Writer)writeMethodswrite
sect2.para: Write the contents of the JSONArray as JSON text to a writer. For compactness, no whitespace is added.
Warning: This method assumes that the data structure is acyclical.

listitem.para: The JSONException is thrown by the JSON.org classes when things are amiss.

sect1.title: Exception JSONException
sect1.para: The JSONException is thrown by the JSON.org classes when things are amiss.

sect2.title: JSONException(String)JSONExceptionMethodsJSONException
sect2.para: Constructs a JSONException with an explanatory message.

entry.para: Detail about the reason for the exception.

sect1.title: Class JSONML
sect1.para: This provides static methods to convert an XML text into a JSONArray or JSONObject, and to covert a JSONArray or JSONObject into an XML text using the JsonML transform.

sect2.title: toJSONArray(String)toJSONArrayMethodstoJSONArray
sect2.para: Convert a well-formed (but not necessarily valid) XML string into a JSONArray using the JsonML transform. Each XML tag is represented as a JSONArray in which the first element is the tag name. If the tag has attributes, then the second element will be JSONObject containing the name/value pairs. If the tag contains children, then strings and JSONArrays will represent the child tags. Comments, prologs, DTDs, and <[ [ ]]> are ignored.

entry.para: A JSONArray containing the structured data from the XML string.

listitem.para: The JSONException is thrown by the JSON.org classes when things are amiss.

sect2.title: toJSONArray(XMLTokener)toJSONArrayMethodstoJSONArray
sect2.para: Convert a well-formed (but not necessarily valid) XML string into a JSONArray using the JsonML transform. Each XML tag is represented as a JSONArray in which the first element is the tag name. If the tag has attributes, then the second element will be JSONObject containing the name/value pairs. If the tag contains children, then strings and JSONArrays will represent the child content and tags. Comments, prologs, DTDs, and <[ [ ]]> are ignored.

entry.para: A JSONArray containing the structured data from the XML string.

listitem.para: The JSONException is thrown by the JSON.org classes when things are amiss.

sect2.title: toJSONObject(String)toJSONObjectMethodstoJSONObject
sect2.para: Convert a well-formed (but not necessarily valid) XML string into a JSONObject using the JsonML transform. Each XML tag is represented as a JSONObject with a "tagName" property. If the tag has attributes, then the attributes will be in the JSONObject as properties. If the tag contains children, the object will have a "childNodes" property which will be an array of strings and JsonML JSONObjects. Comments, prologs, DTDs, and <[ [ ]]> are ignored.

entry.para: A JSONObject containing the structured data from the XML string.

listitem.para: The JSONException is thrown by the JSON.org classes when things are amiss.

sect2.title: toJSONObject(XMLTokener)toJSONObjectMethodstoJSONObject
sect2.para: Convert a well-formed (but not necessarily valid) XML string into a JSONObject using the JsonML transform. Each XML tag is represented as a JSONObject with a "tagName" property. If the tag has attributes, then the attributes will be in the JSONObject as properties. If the tag contains children, the object will have a "childNodes" property which will be an array of strings and JsonML JSONObjects. Comments, prologs, DTDs, and <[ [ ]]> are ignored.

entry.para: An XMLTokener of the XML source text.
A JSONObject containing the structured data from the XML string.

listitem.para: The JSONException is thrown by the JSON.org classes when things are amiss.

sect2.title: toString(JSONArray)toStringMethodstoString
sect2.para: Reverse the JSONML transformation, making an XML text from a JSONArray.

listitem.para: The JSONException is thrown by the JSON.org classes when things are amiss.

sect2.title: toString(JSONObject)toStringMethodstoString
sect2.para: Reverse the JSONML transformation, making an XML text from a JSONObject. The JSONObject must contain a "tagName" property. If it has children, then it must have a "childNodes" property containing an array of objects. The other properties are attributes with string values.

listitem.para: The JSONException is thrown by the JSON.org classes when things are amiss.

sect1.title: Class JSONObject
sect1.para: A JSONObject is an unordered collection of name/value pairs. Its external form is a string wrapped in curly braces with colons between the names and values, and commas between the values and names. The internal form is an object having get and opt methods for accessing the values by name, and put methods for adding or replacing values by name. The values can be any of these types: Boolean, JSONArray, JSONObject, Number, String, or the JSONObject.NULL object. A JSONObject constructor can be used to convert an external form JSON text into an internal form whose values can be retrieved with the get and opt methods, or to convert values into a JSON text using the put and toString methods. A get method returns a value if one can be found, and throws an exception if one cannot be found. An opt method returns a default value instead of throwing an exception, and so is useful for obtaining optional values.

The generic get() and opt() methods return an object, which you can cast or query for type. There are also typed get and opt methods that do type checking and type coercion for you. The opt methods differ from the get methods in that they do not throw. Instead, they return a specified value, such as null.
The put methods add or replace values in an object. For example,
produces the string {"JSON": "Hello, World"}. The texts produced by the toString methods strictly conform to the JSON syntax rules. The constructors are more forgiving in the texts they will accept:

listitem.para: An extra , (comma) may appear just before the closing brace.
Strings may be quoted with

sect2.title: JSONObject()JSONObjectMethodsJSONObject
sect2.para: Construct an empty JSONObject.

sect2.title: JSONObject(JSONObject, String[])JSONObjectMethodsJSONObject
sect2.para: Construct a JSONObject from a subset of another JSONObject. An array of strings is used to identify the keys that should be copied. Missing keys are ignored.

listitem.para: The JSONException is thrown by the JSON.org classes when things are amiss.
If a value is a non-finite number or if a name is duplicated.

sect2.title: JSONObject(JSONTokener)JSONObjectMethodsJSONObject
sect2.para: Construct a JSONObject from a JSONTokener.

entry.para: A JSONTokener object containing the source string.

listitem.para: If there is a syntax error in the source string or a duplicated key.

sect2.title: JSONObject(Map)JSONObjectMethodsJSONObject
sect2.para: Construct a JSONObject from a Map.

entry.para: A map object that can be used to initialize the contents of the JSONObject.

listitem.para: The JSONException is thrown by the JSON.org classes when things are amiss.

sect2.title: JSONObject(Object)JSONObjectMethodsJSONObject
sect2.para: Construct a JSONObject from an Object using bean getters. It reflects on all of the public methods of the object. For each of the methods with no parameters and a name starting with "get" or "is" followed by an uppercase letter, the method is invoked, and a key and the value returned from the getter method are put into the new JSONObject. The key is formed by removing the "get" or "is" prefix. If the second remaining character is not upper case, then the first character is converted to lower case. For example, if an object has a method named "getName", and if the result of calling object.getName() is "Larry Fine", then the JSONObject will contain "name": "Larry Fine".

entry.para: An object that has getter methods that should be used to make a JSONObject.

sect2.title: JSONObject(Object, String[])JSONObjectMethodsJSONObject
sect2.para: Construct a JSONObject from an Object, using reflection to find the public members. The resulting JSONObject's keys will be the strings from the names array, and the values will be the field values associated with those keys in the object. If a key is not found or not visible, then it will not be copied into the new JSONObject.

entry.para: An object that has fields that should be used to make a JSONObject.
An array of strings, the names of the fields to be obtained from the object.

sect2.title: JSONObject(String)JSONObjectMethodsJSONObject
sect2.para: Construct a JSONObject from a source JSON text string. This is the most commonly used JSONObject constructor.

entry.para: A string beginning with { (left brace) and ending with } (right brace).

listitem.para: If there is a syntax error in the source string or a duplicated key.

sect2.title: JSONObject(String, Locale)JSONObjectMethodsJSONObject
sect2.para: Construct a JSONObject from a ResourceBundle.

entry.para: The Locale to load the ResourceBundle for.

listitem.para: If any JSONExceptions are detected.

sect2.title: NULL
sect2.para: It is sometimes more convenient and less ambiguous to have a NULL object than to use Java's null value. JSONObject.NULL.equals(null) returns true. JSONObject.NULL.toString() returns "null".

sect2.title: accumulate(String, Object)accumulateMethodsaccumulate
sect2.para: Accumulate values under a key. It is similar to the put method except that if there is already an object stored under the key then a JSONArray is stored under the key to hold all of the accumulated values. If there is already a JSONArray, then the new value is appended to it. In contrast, the put method replaces the previous value.

entry.para: An object to be accumulated under the key.

listitem.para: If the value is an invalid number or if the key is null.

sect2.title: append(String, Object)appendMethodsappend
sect2.para: Append values to the array under a key. If the key does not exist in the JSONObject, then the key is put in the JSONObject with its value being a JSONArray containing the value parameter. If the key was already associated with a JSONArray, then the value parameter is appended to it.

entry.para: An object to be accumulated under the key.

listitem.para: If the key is null or if the current value associated with the key is not a JSONArray.

sect2.title: doubleToString(double)doubleToStringMethodsdoubleToString
sect2.para: Produce a string from a double. The string "null" will be returned if the number is not finite.

sect2.title: get(String)getMethodsget
sect2.para: Get the value object associated with a key.

entry.para: The object associated with the key.

listitem.para: if the key is not found.

sect2.title: getBoolean(String)getBooleanMethodsgetBoolean
sect2.para: Get the boolean value associated with a key.

listitem.para: if the value is not a Boolean or the String "true" or "false".

sect2.title: getDouble(String)getDoubleMethodsgetDouble
sect2.para: Get the double value associated with a key.

listitem.para: if the key is not found or if the value is not a Number object and cannot be converted to a number.

sect2.title: getInt(String)getIntMethodsgetInt
sect2.para: Get the int value associated with a key.

listitem.para: if the key is not found or if the value cannot be converted to an integer.

sect2.title: getJSONArray(String)getJSONArrayMethodsgetJSONArray
sect2.para: Get the JSONArray value associated with a key.

entry.para: A JSONArray which is the value.

listitem.para: if the key is not found or if the value is not a JSONArray.

sect2.title: getJSONObject(String)getJSONObjectMethodsgetJSONObject
sect2.para: Get the JSONObject value associated with a key.

entry.para: A JSONObject which is the value.

listitem.para: if the key is not found or if the value is not a JSONObject.

sect2.title: getLong(String)getLongMethodsgetLong
sect2.para: Get the long value associated with a key.

listitem.para: if the key is not found or if the value cannot be converted to a long.

sect2.title: getNames(JSONObject)getNamesMethodsgetNames
sect2.para: Get an array of field names from a JSONObject.

entry.para: An array of field names, or null if there are no names.

sect2.title: getNames(Object)getNamesMethodsgetNames
sect2.para: Get an array of field names from an Object.

entry.para: An array of field names, or null if there are no names.

sect2.title: getString(String)getStringMethodsgetString
sect2.para: Get the string associated with a key.

entry.para: A string which is the value.

listitem.para: if the key is not found.

sect2.title: has(String)hasMethodshas
sect2.para: Determine if the JSONObject contains a specific key.

entry.para: true if the key exists in the JSONObject.

sect2.title: increment(String)incrementMethodsincrement
sect2.para: Increment a property of a JSONObject. If there is no such property, create one with a value of 1. If there is such a property, and if it is an Integer, Long, Double, or Float, then add one to it.

listitem.para: If there is already a property with this name that is not an Integer, Long, Double, or Float.

sect2.title: isNull(String)isNullMethodsisNull
sect2.para: Determine if the value associated with the key is null or if there is no value.

entry.para: true if there is no value associated with the key or if the value is the JSONObject.NULL object.

sect2.title: keys()keysMethodskeys
sect2.para: Get an enumeration of the keys of the JSONObject.

sect2.title: length()lengthMethodslength
sect2.para: Get the number of keys stored in the JSONObject.

entry.para: The number of keys in the JSONObject.

sect2.title: names()namesMethodsnames
sect2.para: Produce a JSONArray containing the names of the elements of this JSONObject.

entry.para: A JSONArray containing the key strings, or null if the JSONObject is empty.

sect2.title: numberToString(Number)numberToStringMethodsnumberToString
sect2.para: Produce a string from a Number.

listitem.para: If n is a non-finite number.

sect2.title: opt(String)optMethodsopt
sect2.para: Get an optional value associated with a key.

entry.para: An object which is the value, or null if there is no value.

sect2.title: optBoolean(String)optBooleanMethodsoptBoolean
sect2.para: Get an optional boolean associated with a key. It returns false if there is no such key, or if the value is not Boolean.TRUE or the String "true".

sect2.title: optBoolean(String, boolean)optBooleanMethodsoptBoolean
sect2.para: Get an optional boolean associated with a key. It returns the defaultValue if there is no such key, or if it is not a Boolean or the String "true" or "false" (case insensitive).

sect2.title: optDouble(String)optDoubleMethodsoptDouble
sect2.para: Get an optional double associated with a key, or NaN if there is no such key or if its value is not a number. If the value is a string, an attempt will be made to evaluate it as a number.

entry.para: A string which is the key.
An object which is the value.

sect2.title: optDouble(String, double)optDoubleMethodsoptDouble
sect2.para: Get an optional double associated with a key, or the defaultValue if there is no such key or if its value is not a number. If the value is a string, an attempt will be made to evaluate it as a number.

entry.para: An object which is the value.

sect2.title: optInt(String)optIntMethodsoptInt
sect2.para: Get an optional int value associated with a key, or zero if there is no such key or if the value is not a number. If the value is a string, an attempt will be made to evaluate it as a number.

entry.para: An object which is the value.

sect2.title: optInt(String, int)optIntMethodsoptInt
sect2.para: Get an optional int value associated with a key, or the default if there is no such key or if the value is not a number. If the value is a string, an attempt will be made to evaluate it as a number.

entry.para: An object which is the value.

sect2.title: optJSONArray(String)optJSONArrayMethodsoptJSONArray
sect2.para: Get an optional JSONArray associated with a key. It returns null if there is no such key, or if its value is not a JSONArray.

entry.para: A JSONArray which is the value.

sect2.title: optJSONObject(String)optJSONObjectMethodsoptJSONObject
sect2.para: Get an optional JSONObject associated with a key. It returns null if there is no such key, or if its value is not a JSONObject.

entry.para: A JSONObject which is the value.

sect2.title: optLong(String)optLongMethodsoptLong
sect2.para: Get an optional long value associated with a key, or zero if there is no such key or if the value is not a number. If the value is a string, an attempt will be made to evaluate it as a number.

entry.para: An object which is the value.

sect2.title: optLong(String, long)optLongMethodsoptLong
sect2.para: Get an optional long value associated with a key, or the default if there is no such key or if the value is not a number. If the value is a string, an attempt will be made to evaluate it as a number.

entry.para: An object which is the value.

sect2.title: optString(String)optStringMethodsoptString
sect2.para: Get an optional string associated with a key. It returns an empty string if there is no such key. If the value is not a string and is not null, then it is converted to a string.

entry.para: A string which is the value.

sect2.title: optString(String, String)optStringMethodsoptString
sect2.para: Get an optional string associated with a key. It returns the defaultValue if there is no such key.

entry.para: A string which is the value.

sect2.para: Put a key/boolean pair in the JSONObject.

entry.para: A boolean which is the value.

listitem.para: If the key is null.

sect2.para: Put a key/value pair in the JSONObject, where the value will be a JSONArray which is produced from a Collection.

listitem.para: The JSONException is thrown by the JSON.org classes when things are amiss.

sect2.para: Put a key/double pair in the JSONObject.

listitem.para: If the key is null or if the number is invalid.

sect2.para: Put a key/int pair in the JSONObject.

entry.para: An int which is the value.

listitem.para: If the key is null.

sect2.title: put(String, long)putMethodsput
sect2.para: Put a key/long pair in the JSONObject.

entry.para: A long which is the value.

listitem.para: If the key is null.

sect2.title: put(String, Map)putMethodsput
sect2.para: Put a key/value pair in the JSONObject, where the value will be a JSONObject which is produced from a Map.

listitem.para: The JSONException is thrown by the JSON.org classes when things are amiss.

sect2.title: put(String, Object)putMethodsput
sect2.para: Put a key/value pair in the JSONObject. If the value is null, then the key will be removed from the JSONObject if it is present.

entry.para: An object which is the value. It should be of one of these types: Boolean, Double, Integer, JSONArray, JSONObject, Long, String, or the JSONObject.NULL object.

listitem.para: If the value is non-finite number or if the key is null.

sect2.title: putOnce(String, Object)putOnceMethodsputOnce
sect2.para: Put a key/value pair in the JSONObject, but only if the key and the value are both non-null, and only if there is not already a member with that name.

listitem.para: if the key is a duplicate

sect2.title: putOpt(String, Object)putOptMethodsputOpt
sect2.para: Put a key/value pair in the JSONObject, but only if the key and the value are both non-null.

entry.para: An object which is the value. It should be of one of these types: Boolean, Double, Integer, JSONArray, JSONObject, Long, String, or the JSONObject.NULL object.

listitem.para: If the value is a non-finite number.

entry.para: A String correctly formatted for insertion in a JSON text.

sect2.title: remove(String)removeMethodsremove
sect2.para: Remove a name and its value, if present.

entry.para: The value that was associated with the name, or null if there was no value.

sect2.title: sortedKeys()sortedKeysMethodssortedKeys
sect2.para: Get an enumeration of the keys of the JSONObject. The keys will be sorted alphabetically.

sect2.title: stringToValue(String)stringToValueMethodsstringToValue
sect2.para: Try to convert a string into a number, boolean, or null. If the string can't be converted, return the string.

sect2.title: testValidity(Object)testValidityMethodstestValidity
sect2.para: Throw an exception if the object is a NaN or infinite number.

listitem.para: If o is a non-finite number.

sect2.title: toJSONArray(JSONArray)toJSONArrayMethodstoJSONArray
sect2.para: Produce a JSONArray containing the values of the members of this JSONObject.

entry.para: A JSONArray containing a list of key strings. This determines the sequence of the values in the result.

listitem.para: If any of the values are non-finite numbers.

sect2.title: toString()toStringMethodstoString
sect2.para: Make a JSON text of this JSONObject. For compactness, no whitespace is added. If this would not result in a syntactically correct JSON text, then null will be returned instead.
Warning: This method assumes that the data structure is acyclical.

entry.para: a printable, displayable, portable, transmittable representation of the object, beginning with { (left brace) and ending with } (right brace).

sect2.title: toString(int)toStringMethodstoString
sect2.para: Make a prettyprinted JSON text of this JSONObject.
Warning: This method assumes that the data structure is acyclical.

entry.para: The number of spaces to add to each level of indentation.
a printable, displayable, portable, transmittable representation of the object, beginning with { (left brace) and ending with } (right brace).

listitem.para: If the object contains an invalid number.

sect2.title: valueToString(Object)valueToStringMethodsvalueToString
sect2.para: Make a JSON text of an Object value. If the object has an value.toJSONString() method, then that method will be used to produce the JSON text. The method is required to produce a strictly conforming text. If the object does not contain a toJSONString method (which is the most common case), then a text will be produced by other means. If the value is an array or Collection, then a JSONArray will be made from it and its toJSONString method will be called. If the value is a MAP, then a JSONObject will be made from it and its toJSONString method will be called. Otherwise, the value's toString method will be called, and the result will be quoted.
Warning: This method assumes that the data structure is acyclical.

entry.para: a printable, displayable, transmittable representation of the object, beginning with { (left brace) and ending with } (right brace).

listitem.para: If the value is or contains an invalid number.

sect2.title: wrap(Object)wrapMethodswrap
sect2.para: Wrap an object, if necessary. If the object is null, return the NULL object. If it is an array or collection, wrap it in a JSONArray. If it is a map, wrap it in a JSONObject. If it is a standard property (Double, String, et al) then it is already wrapped. Otherwise, if it comes from one of the java packages, turn it into a string. And if it doesn't, try to wrap it in a JSONObject. If the wrapping fails, then null is returned.

sect2.title: write(Writer)writeMethodswrite
sect2.para: Write the contents of the JSONObject as JSON text to a writer. For compactness, no whitespace is added.
Warning: This method assumes that the data structure is acyclical.

listitem.para: The JSONException is thrown by the JSON.org classes when things are amiss.

sect1.title: Interface JSONString
sect1.para: The JSONString interface allows a toJSONString() method so that a class can change the behavior of JSONObject.toString(), JSONArray.toString(), and JSONWriter.value(Object). The toJSONString method will be used instead of the default behavior of using the Object's toString() method and quoting the result.

sect2.title: toJSONString()toJSONStringMethodstoJSONString
sect2.para: The toJSONString method allows a class to produce its own JSON serialization.

entry.para: A strictly syntactically correct JSON text.

sect1.title: Class JSONStringer
sect1.para: JSONStringer provides a quick and convenient way of producing JSON text. The texts produced strictly conform to JSON syntax rules. No whitespace is added, so the results are ready for transmission or storage. Each instance of JSONStringer can produce one JSON text.

A JSONStringer instance provides a value method for appending values to the text, and a key method for adding keys before values in objects. There are array and endArray methods that make and bound array values, and object and endObject methods which make and bound object values. All of these methods return the JSONWriter instance, permitting cascade style. For example,

which produces the string {"JSON":"Hello, World!"} The first method called must be array or object. There are no methods for adding commas or colons. JSONStringer adds them for you. Objects and arrays can be nested up to 20 levels deep.
This can sometimes be easier than using a JSONObject to build a string.

sect2.title: JSONStringer()JSONStringerMethodsJSONStringer
sect2.para: Make a fresh JSONStringer. It can be used to build one JSON text.

sect2.title: toString()toStringMethodstoString
sect2.para: Return the JSON text. This method is used to obtain the product of the JSONStringer instance. It will return null if there was a problem in the construction of the JSON text (such as the calls to array were not properly balanced with calls to endArray).

sect1.title: Class JSONTokener
sect1.para: A JSONTokener takes a source string and extracts characters and tokens from it. It is used by the JSONObject and JSONArray constructors to parse JSON source strings.

sect2.title: Synopsis
sect2.para: Direct known subclasses: org.­json.­HTTPTokenerorg.­json.­XMLTokener

sect2.title: JSONTokener(InputStream)JSONTokenerMethodsJSONTokener
sect2.para: Construct a JSONTokener from an InputStream.

sect2.title: JSONTokener(Reader)JSONTokenerMethodsJSONTokener
sect2.para: Construct a JSONTokener from a Reader.

sect2.title: JSONTokener(String)JSONTokenerMethodsJSONTokener
sect2.para: Construct a JSONTokener from a string.

sect2.title: back()backMethodsback
sect2.para: Back up one character. This provides a sort of lookahead capability, so that you can test for a digit or letter before attempting to parse the next number or identifier.

sect2.title: dehexchar(char)dehexcharMethodsdehexchar
sect2.para: Get the hex value of a character (base16).

entry.para: A character between '0' and '9' or between 'A' and 'F' or between 'a' and 'f'.
An int between 0 and 15, or -1 if c was not a hex digit.

sect2.title: more()moreMethodsmore
sect2.para: Determine if the source string still contains characters that next() can consume.

entry.para: true if not yet at the end of the source.

sect2.title: next()nextMethodsnext
sect2.para: Get the next character in the source string.

entry.para: The next character, or 0 if past the end of the source string.

sect2.title: next(char)nextMethodsnext
sect2.para: Consume the next character, and check that it matches a specified character.

listitem.para: if the character does not match.

sect2.title: next(int)nextMethodsnext
sect2.para: Get the next n characters.

entry.para: The number of characters to take.

listitem.para: Substring bounds error if there are not n characters remaining in the source string.

sect2.title: nextClean()nextCleanMethodsnextClean
sect2.para: Get the next char in the string, skipping whitespace.

entry.para: A character, or 0 if there are no more characters.

listitem.para: The JSONException is thrown by the JSON.org classes when things are amiss.

sect2.title: nextString(char)nextStringMethodsnextString
sect2.para: Return the characters up to the next close quote character. Backslash processing is done. The formal JSON format does not allow strings in single quotes, but an implementation is allowed to accept them.

listitem.para: Unterminated string.

sect2.title: nextTo(char)nextToMethodsnextTo
sect2.para: Get the text up but not including the specified character or the end of line, whichever comes first.

sect2.title: nextTo(String)nextToMethodsnextTo
sect2.para: Get the text up but not including one of the specified delimiter characters or the end of line, whichever comes first.

sect2.title: nextValue()nextValueMethodsnextValue
sect2.para: Get the next value. The value can be a Boolean, Double, Integer, JSONArray, JSONObject, Long, or String, or the JSONObject.NULL object.

listitem.para: If syntax error.

sect2.title: skipTo(char)skipToMethodsskipTo
sect2.para: Skip characters until the next character is the requested character. If the requested character is not found, no characters are skipped.

entry.para: The requested character, or zero if the requested character is not found.

sect2.title: syntaxError(String)syntaxErrorMethodssyntaxError
sect2.para: Make a JSONException to signal a syntax error.

entry.para: A JSONException object, suitable for throwing

sect2.title: toString()toStringMethodstoString
sect2.para: Make a printable string of this JSONTokener.

sect1.title: Class JSONWriter
sect1.para: JSONWriter provides a quick and convenient way of producing JSON text. The texts produced strictly conform to JSON syntax rules. No whitespace is added, so the results are ready for transmission or storage. Each instance of JSONWriter can produce one JSON text.

A JSONWriter instance provides a value method for appending values to the text, and a key method for adding keys before values in objects. There are array and endArray methods that make and bound array values, and object and endObject methods which make and bound object values. All of these methods return the JSONWriter instance, permitting a cascade style. For example,

which writes {"JSON":"Hello, World!"} The first method called must be array or object. There are no methods for adding commas or colons. JSONWriter adds them for you. Objects and arrays can be nested up to 20 levels deep.
This can sometimes be easier than using a JSONObject to build a string.

sect2.title: Synopsis
sect2.para: Direct known subclasses: org.­json.­JSONStringer

sect2.title: JSONWriter(Writer)JSONWriterMethodsJSONWriter
sect2.para: Make a fresh JSONWriter. It can be used to build one JSON text.

sect2.title: array()arrayMethodsarray
sect2.para: Begin appending a new array. All values until the balancing endArray will be appended to this array. The endArray method must be called to mark the array's end.

listitem.para: If the nesting is too deep, or if the object is started in the wrong place (for example as a key or after the end of the outermost array or object).

sect2.title: endArray()endArrayMethodsendArray
sect2.para: End an array. This method most be called to balance calls to array.

listitem.para: If incorrectly nested.

sect2.title: endObject()endObjectMethodsendObject
sect2.para: End an object. This method most be called to balance calls to object.

listitem.para: If incorrectly nested.

sect2.title: key(String)keyMethodskey
sect2.para: Append a key. The key will be associated with the next value. In an object, every value must be preceded by a key.

listitem.para: If the key is out of place. For example, keys do not belong in arrays or if the key is null.

sect2.title: object()objectMethodsobject
sect2.para: Begin appending a new object. All keys and values until the balancing endObject will be appended to this object. The endObject method must be called to mark the object's end.

listitem.para: If the nesting is too deep, or if the object is started in the wrong place (for example as a key or after the end of the outermost array or object).

sect2.title: value(boolean)valueMethodsvalue
sect2.para: Append either the value true or the value false.

listitem.para: The JSONException is thrown by the JSON.org classes when things are amiss.

sect2.title: value(double)valueMethodsvalue
sect2.para: Append a double value.

listitem.para: If the number is not finite.

sect2.title: value(long)valueMethodsvalue
sect2.para: Append a long value.

listitem.para: The JSONException is thrown by the JSON.org classes when things are amiss.

sect2.title: value(Object)valueMethodsvalue
sect2.para: Append an object value.

entry.para: The object to append. It can be null, or a Boolean, Number, String, JSONObject, or JSONArray, or an object that implements JSONString.

listitem.para: If the value is out of sequence.

sect1.title: Class XML
sect1.para: This provides static methods to convert an XML text into a JSONObject, and to covert a JSONObject into an XML text.

sect2.title: AMP
sect2.para: The Character '&'.

sect2.title: APOS
sect2.para: The Character '''.

sect2.title: BANG
sect2.para: The Character '!'.

sect2.title: EQ
sect2.para: The Character '='.

sect2.title: GT
sect2.para: The Character '>'.

sect2.title: LT
sect2.para: The Character '<'.

sect2.title: QUEST
sect2.para: The Character '?'.

sect2.title: QUOT
sect2.para: The Character '"'.

sect2.title: SLASH
sect2.para: The Character '/'.

sect2.title: escape(String)escapeMethodsescape
sect2.para: Replace special characters with XML escapes:

sect2.title: noSpace(String)noSpaceMethodsnoSpace
sect2.para: Throw an exception if the string contains whitespace. Whitespace is not allowed in tagNames and attributes.

listitem.para: The JSONException is thrown by the JSON.org classes when things are amiss.

sect2.title: stringToValue(String)stringToValueMethodsstringToValue
sect2.para: Try to convert a string into a number, boolean, or null. If the string can't be converted, return the string. This is much less ambitious than JSONObject.stringToValue, especially because it does not attempt to convert plus forms, octal forms, hex forms, or E forms lacking decimal points.

sect2.title: toJSONObject(String)toJSONObjectMethodstoJSONObject
sect2.para: Convert a well-formed (but not necessarily valid) XML string into a JSONObject. Some information may be lost in this transformation because JSON is a data format and XML is a document format. XML uses elements, attributes, and content text, while JSON uses unordered collections of name/value pairs and arrays of values. JSON does not does not like to distinguish between elements and attributes. Sequences of similar elements are represented as JSONArrays. Content text may be placed in a "content" member. Comments, prologs, DTDs, and <[ [ ]]> are ignored.

entry.para: A JSONObject containing the structured data from the XML string.

listitem.para: The JSONException is thrown by the JSON.org classes when things are amiss.

sect2.title: toString(Object)toStringMethodstoString
sect2.para: Convert a JSONObject into a well-formed, element-normal XML string.

listitem.para: The JSONException is thrown by the JSON.org classes when things are amiss.

sect2.title: toString(Object, String)toStringMethodstoString
sect2.para: Convert a JSONObject into a well-formed, element-normal XML string.

entry.para: The optional name of the enclosing tag.

listitem.para: The JSONException is thrown by the JSON.org classes when things are amiss.

sect1.title: Class XMLTokener
sect1.para: The XMLTokener extends the JSONTokener to provide additional methods for the parsing of XML texts.

sect2.title: XMLTokener(String)XMLTokenerMethodsXMLTokener
sect2.para: Construct an XMLTokener from a string.

sect2.title: entity
sect2.para: The table of entity values. It initially contains Character values for amp, apos, gt, lt, quot.

sect2.title: nextCDATA()nextCDATAMethodsnextCDATA
sect2.para: Get the text in the CDATA block.

listitem.para: If the ]]> is not found.

sect2.title: nextContent()nextContentMethodsnextContent
sect2.para: Get the next XML outer token, trimming whitespace. There are two kinds of tokens: the '<' character which begins a markup tag, and the content text between markup tags.

entry.para: A string, or a '<' Character, or null if there is no more source text.

listitem.para: The JSONException is thrown by the JSON.org classes when things are amiss.

sect2.title: nextEntity(char)nextEntityMethodsnextEntity
sect2.para: Return the next entity. These entities are translated to Characters: & ' > < ".

entry.para: A Character or an entity String if the entity is not recognized.

listitem.para: If missing ';' in XML entity.

sect2.title: nextMeta()nextMetaMethodsnextMeta
sect2.para: Returns the next XML meta token. This is used for skipping over <!...> and <?...?> structures.

entry.para: Syntax characters (< > / = ! ?) are returned as Character, and strings and names are returned as Boolean. We don't care what the values actually are.

listitem.para: If a string is not properly closed or if the XML is badly structured.

sect2.title: nextToken()nextTokenMethodsnextToken
sect2.para: Get the next XML Token. These tokens are found inside of angle brackets. It may be one of these characters: / > = ! ? or it may be a string wrapped in single quotes or double quotes, or it may be a name.

listitem.para: If the XML is not well formed.

sect2.title: skipPast(String)skipPastMethodsskipPast
sect2.para: Skip characters until past the requested string. If it is not found, we are left at the end of the source with a result of false.

listitem.para: The JSONException is thrown by the JSON.org classes when things are amiss.
